unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Two-Sample T-Interval
question_text: A two-sample T-interval attempts to estimate

choices.text: The mean of the sum of the two samples.
The mean of the difference between two samples.
The mean of the sum of the two populations.
The mean of the difference between two populations.

solution:
A two-sample T-interval attempts to estimate the true difference between two population means.

Sample means will always be known, so it does not make sense to speculate on what the difference might be between the two samples.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'E'.
